DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pain Medication Past Day Specify Second Oral Cavity Quadrant Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the use of specific pain medication in the past 24 hours (DEC was changed to fit UML model use) in the second quadrant of the mouth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredName: Past Day Specify Second Oral Cavity Quadrant Use
Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:Be specific about something; define clearly.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
